docs.attr:author: Blank
docs.attr:title: Warne returns to big stage
docs.attr:summary: Champion leg spinner Shane Warne has signed on to play with Melbourne Stars in the inaugural Big Bash League Twenty20 tournament at the end of the year.

docs.attr:author: Blank
docs.attr:title: Williams apologises to Tiger for slur
docs.attr:summary: Tiger Woods says he was hurt by a racist slur from his former caddie Steve Williams who referred to him as a "black arsehole".

docs.attr:author: Blank
docs.attr:title: Thorpe bombs out in Beijing
docs.attr:summary: In a sobering reality check Ian Thorpe has failed to qualify for the 100 metres freestyle final at the FINA World Cup short course meet in Beijing.

docs.attr:author: Blank
docs.attr:title: Ponting takes aim at 'underdone' Proteas
docs.attr:summary: Ricky Ponting believes South Africa could suffer from a lack of first-class preparation in the opening Test in Cape Town on Wednesday.

docs.attr:author: Blank
docs.attr:title: T-Rex charged over high shot
docs.attr:summary: Tony Williams is likely to miss Australia's Four Nations clash with Wales this weekend after being charged with a high tackle on England back rower Ben Westwood.

docs.attr:author: Blank
docs.attr:title: Teen knocks off Parko in final
docs.attr:summary: Australian Joel Parkinson has lost the final of the Rip Curl Pro Search to rising Brazilian teenage sensation Gabriel Medina in San Francisco.

docs.attr:author: Blank
docs.attr:title: Rugby returns to Christchurch
docs.attr:summary: A 17000-seat temporary stadium will host rugby union matches including an All Blacks v Ireland Test in earthquake-hit Christchurch next year Prime Minister John Key said.

docs.attr:author: Blank
docs.attr:title: Bangkok floods force Socceroos switch
docs.attr:summary: Australia's World Cup qualifier against Thailand next week has been moved to another stadium in Bangkok because of flooding in the city Football Federation Australia said.

docs.attr:author: Blank
docs.attr:title: Pakistan shines on pitch with series win
docs.attr:summary: Pakistan highlighted its talent on the pitch to draw the third and final Test against Sri Lanka in Sharjah and win the series 1-0 just days after three former team-mates were jailed for spot-fixing.

docs.attr:author: Blank
docs.attr:title: Sammy and Bishoo spark India collapse
docs.attr:summary: Darren Sammy and Devendra Bishoo shared five wickets to trigger India's collapse on the second day of the opening Test against the West Indies in New Delhi.

docs.attr:author: Blank
docs.attr:title: O'Driscoll out of Six Nations
docs.attr:summary: Ireland rugby captain Brian O'Driscoll has been ruled out of action for up to six months and will miss his country's Six Nations campaign when the annual tournament kicks off in February.

docs.attr:author: Blank
docs.attr:title: Federer charges to fifth Basel title
docs.attr:summary: Roger Federer has returned to winning mode 10 months after his last title as the home tennis hero schooled Japanese wild card Kei Nishikori 6-1 6-3 to win a fifth Swiss Indoors title in Basel.

docs.attr:author: Blank
docs.attr:title: Lucky Spurs hold off Fulham
docs.attr:summary: Tottenham Hotspur has survived a late onslaught to earn a somewhat fortunate 3-1 win at London rival Fulham and remain fifth in the English Premier League standings.

docs.attr:author: Blank
docs.attr:title: Czechs take out Fed Cup
docs.attr:summary: Doubles duo Lucie Hradecka and Kveta Peschke sealed a 3-2 victory for the Czech Republic in the Fed Cup final against Russia in Moscow.

docs.attr:author: Blank
docs.attr:title: David wins record sixth squash world title
docs.attr:summary: Malaysian squash superstar Nicol David has won a record sixth women's World Open title overtaking Australia's Sarah Fitz-Gerald.
